document_metadata.title: TransUnion Public Records Section - False Date Paid Information
document_metadata.primary_purpose: Document incorrect 'Date Paid: 01/10/2024' - case closed date not discharge date

fcra_sections.1681e(b): Reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy
fcra_sections.1681i(a): Procedure in case of disputed accuracy

timeline_context.event: Case closed with discharge WITHHELD due to missing DS2830 form
timeline_context.significance: TransUnion incorrectly reports this as 'Date Paid'

timeline_context.event: Actual bankruptcy discharge granted by court
timeline_context.significance: True resolution date - when debts were legally eliminated
TransUnion updated record but maintained false Date Paid

timeline_context.event: TransUnion continues reporting false Date Paid
timeline_context.significance: Over 1 year of false date reporting

violations_identified.description: Reports case closure date (01/10/2024) as 'Date Paid' instead of actual discharge date (02/09/2024)
violations_identified.legal_significance: Misrepresents when consumer's legal obligations were actually resolved
violations_identified.harm_caused: Conceals 30-day vulnerability window when creditors attacked

violations_identified.description: False Date Paid obscures the January 10 - February 9 window when consumer had no discharge protection
violations_identified.harm_caused: Enables creditor defense that protection existed during attack period

violations_identified.description: Failed to maintain maximum possible accuracy in critical date reporting
violations_identified.harm_caused: Inaccurate timeline affects legal analysis of FCRA violations

case_closure_vs_discharge.case_closure_meaning: Administrative closure with discharge withheld pending DS2830 filing
case_closure_vs_discharge.consumer_protection: Discharge provides FCRA protection; closure without discharge does not

vulnerability_window.creditor_exploitation: 10 negative items appeared January 17 during this window

false_narrative_creation.legal_impact: Enables creditor defense of good faith reporting

creditor_attack_correlation.january_17_2024: 10 negative items appeared via Experian alerts during vulnerability window
creditor_attack_correlation.creditor_defense_enabled: False Date Paid allows creditors to claim they believed consumer was protected
creditor_attack_correlation.pattern_concealment: Obscures coordinated timing of creditor attacks during vulnerable period

willfulness_indicators: Clear distinction between case closure and discharge dates
Updated record in February 2024 but maintained false Date Paid
Over 1 year of continued false date reporting
strategic_significance.case_impact: Undermines creditor defenses by exposing true vulnerability timeline
strategic_significance.bureau_liability: Direct TransUnion responsibility for accurate date reporting
